alert.note: Alert for Morrison (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:20PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Morrison County through 545 PM CDT... At 519 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Randall, or 18 miles northwest of Little Falls, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Morrison County, including the following locations... Cushing and Crow Wing State Park. This includes U.S. Highway 10 in Minnesota between mile markers 127 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
